messages.title: YOUR BILL FOR THE COST OF CORBYN
messages.content: The leaflet outlines the purported costs of policies proposed by Jeremy Corbyn, including nationalization, a four-day work week, universal basic income, and the cost of continued Brexit debates.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: New homes tax on EVERY home
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet claims a cost implicating an increase of £375 more than the average council tax bill.
The leaflet associates the policy with a cost of £13.5 billion to the taxpayer.
The leaflet claims no standards in schools and a worse education for children without Ofsted and SATs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Putting politicians in charge of energy and water companies
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Suggests that bills would raise by £2,000 per household.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet mentions the tactical situation, suggesting that only 7,331 people need to change their vote to prevent Jeremy Corbyn's Labour.

issues.brexitEurope: More arguing about Brexit – and no action on our priorities
issues.economy: Associates Corbyn's policies with a total economic cost of £1.2 trillion.
issues.education: References scrapping Ofsted and SATs affecting standards in schools and education for children.
issues.governance: Putting politicians in charge of rail, energy, water, and postal services
issues.health: Cost of a four-day week, hitting vital public services like the NHS
issues.socialWelfare: Universal basic income, giving free money to the super rich and prisoners

housing.content: New homes tax on EVERY home

images.caption: Campaign leaflet images depicting concerns over higher tax on homes, abolishing Ofsted and SATs, and politicians in charge of water and energy supplies.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet's aim is to encourage strategic voting to prevent a Labour government led by Jeremy Corbyn.
